name: top
desc: The top command line can display the system's operating status in real time. With the top command line, you can view the system load, CPU usage, memory usage, process information, etc.

-u.name: Specify the username whose process information is to be displayed

-p.name: Display information for the specified process

-n.name: Set the number of processes to be displayed

-d.name: Set the time interval between two refreshes

-t.name: Display the sum of process and CPU states

content:
Example

  • Display system load and CPU usage: top
  • Display process information: top -u username
  • Display information for a specified process: top -p pid
  • Refresh every 5 seconds: top -d 5
  • Display memory usage: top -l
  • Display thread information: top -H
  • Display a summary of processes and CPU states: top -t
  • Display process memory usage: top -m
